text: Is there anything special you need to do for your blog listing index template changes to show up on the page that is using that template? It doesn't seem to be showing my changes in the editor or preview mode, so it's not a cache issue. Do I have to change the template and reassign it every time? Because I've tried that and that doesn't seem to be working either.

As long as your template is the active template listed in blog settings (might be worth double checking if you have multiple blogs) they should behave as standard templates. Updates to the templates should reflect in the page. Note that just changing template level module fields or adding new modules etc to a template likely won’t pick up if the page has been modified at the page editor level. As those page level edits would be overriding the default template settings.
All n all the listing page should work the same way as a standard page.

I think that's the issue I'm having. I made some things in the editor and copied the hubl code and pasted it into my template, then deleted it in the editor and it's not coming back from being in my template. I wanted to give it a class so I can apply CSS to it. I don't know how to trigger it to pull from the template now.
Hmmmmm in not sure I follow 100% — but you could maybe check to see if revision history will reset the state?
Other options would be adding a classname around the DND area — then targeting the module specific classnames with that wrapper specificity

So here's my template. I added the sections back in the editor because I couldn't get them to show up otherwise, but the code doesn't have my class on it. I'm also trying to use a different widget entirely to display the blog posts and that's not showing up either. It's just not applying any of my changes. And yes, I did double and triple check that I'm editing the correct template.

Is your class “next-gen-banner”? I don’t think that html markup is valid inside of DND areas. So it’s likely that is getting stripped out. That is because there would be no real way to preserve this at the page level when a marketer drags in new sections. The dnd markup + the page editor work because the DND markup outputs and expects a certain html structure to exist.

The section class feature only works in `saved sections` ie — templateized sections included in your theme. <https://arc.net/l/quote/hmtyxmms|More details>
Hi Everyone, I just wanted to confirm which option is better for website landing pages: HubSpot React CMS or HubSpot HubL CMS?
